draw_text.description:
[Function]draw_text(x,y,string) 
Draws the string at position (x,y), using the drawing color and alpha. A # symbol or carriage return chr(13) or linefeed chr(10) are interpreted as newline characters. In this way you can draw multi-line texts. (Use \# to get the # symbol itself.)

draw_text_ext.description:
[Function]draw_text_ext(x,y,string) 
Similar to the previous routine but you can specify two more things. First of all, sep indicates the separation distance between the lines of text in a multiline text. Use -1 to get the default distance. Use w to indicate the width of the text in pixels. Lines that are longer than this width are split- up at spaces or - signs. Use -1 to not split up lines.

draw_arrow.description:
[Function]draw_arrow(x1,y1,x2,y2,size) 
Draws an arrow from (x1,y1) to (x2,y2). size indicates the size of the arrow in pixels.

draw_button.description:
[Function]draw_button(x1,y1,x2,y2,up) 
Draws a button, up indicates whether up (1) or down (0).

draw_path.description:
[Function]draw_path(path,x,y,absolute) 
With this function you can draw the indicated path in the room with its start at position (x,y). If absolute is true the path is drawn at the position where it was defined and the values of x and y are ignored.

draw_healthbar.description:
[Function]draw_healthbar(x1,y1,x2,y2,amount,backcol,mincol,maxcol,direction,showback,showborder) 
With this function you can draw a healthbar (or any other bar that indicates some value, like e.g. the damage). The arguments x1, y1, x2 and y2 indicate the total area for the bar. amount indicates the percentage of the bar that must be filled (must lie between 0 and 100). backcol is the color of the background for the bar. mincol and maxcol indicate the color when the amount is 0 and 100 respectively. For an amount in between the color is interpolated. So you can easily make a bar that goes e.g. from green to red. The direction is the direction in which the bar is drawn. 0 indicates that the bar is anchored at the left, 1 at the right, 2 at the top and 3 at the bottom. Finally showback indicates whether a background box must be shown and showborder indicated whether the box and bar should have a black border line.

draw_clear.description:
[Function]draw_clear(col) 
Clears the entire room in the given color (no alpha blending).

draw_clear_alpha.description:
[Function]draw_clear_alpha(col,alpha)
Clears the entire room in the given color and alpha value (in particular useful for surfaces).

draw_point.description: [Function]draw_point(x,y) nDraws a point at (x,y) in the current color.

draw_line_width.description:
[Function]draw_line_width(x1,y1,x2,y2,w) 
Draws a line from (x1,y1) to (x2,y2) with width w.

draw_rectangle.description:
[Function]draw_rectanglet(x1,y1,x2,y2,outline) 
Draws a rectangle. outline indicates whether only the outline must be drawn (true) or it should be filled (false).

draw_roundrect.description:
[Function]draw_roundrect(x1,y1,x2,y2,outline) 
Draws a rounded rectangle. outline indicates whether only the outline must be drawn (true) or it should be filled (false).

draw_triangle.description:
[Function]draw_triangle(x1,y1,x2,y2,x3,y3,outline) 
Draws a triangle. outline indicates whether only the outline must be drawn (true) or it should be filled (false).

draw_circle.description:
[Function]draw_circle(x,y,r,outline) 
Draws a circle at (x,y) with radius r. outline indicates whether only the outline must be drawn (true) or it should be filled (false).

draw_ellipse.description:
[Function]draw_ellipse(x1,y1,x2,y2,outline) 
Draws an ellipse. outline indicates whether only the outline must be drawn (true) or it should be filled (false).

draw_set_circle_precision.description:
[Function]draw_set_circle_precision(precision) 
Sets the precision with which circles are drawn, that is, the number of segments they consist of. The precision must lie between 4 and 64 and must be dividable by 4. This is also used for drawing ellipses and rounded rectangles.

draw_set_color.description:
[Function]draw_set_color(col) 
Sets the drawing color to be used from now on for drawing primitives.

draw_set_alpha.description:
[Function]draw_set_alpha(alpha) 
Sets the alpha transparency value to be used from now on for drawing primitives. Should lie in the range 0-1. 0 is fully transparent, 1 is fully opaque.

draw_get_color.description:
[Function]draw_get_color() 
Returns the drawing color used for drawing primitives.

draw_get_alpha.description:
[Function]draw_get_alpha() 
Returns the alpha value used for drawing primitives.

draw_getpixel.description:
[Function]draw_getpixel(x,y) 
Returns the color of the pixel corresponding to position (x,y) in the room. This is not very fast, so use with care.

draw_sprite.description:
[Function]draw_sprite(sprite,subimg,x,y) 
Draws subimage subimg (-1 = current) of the sprite with its origin at position (x,y). (Without color blending and no alpha transparency.)

draw_sprite_stretched.description:
[Function]draw_sprite_stretched(sprite,subimg,x,y,w,h) 
Draws the sprite stretched so that it fills the region with top-left corner (x,y) and width w and height h.

draw_sprite_tiled.description:
[Function]draw_sprite_tiled(sprite,subimg,x,y) 
Draws the sprite tiled so that it fills the entire room. (x,y) is the place where one of the sprites is drawn.

draw_sprite_part.description:
[Function]draw_sprite_part(sprite,subimg,left,top,width,height,x,y) 
Draws the indicated part of subimage subimg (-1 = current) of the sprite with the top-left corner of the part at position (x,y).

draw_background.description:
[Function]draw_background(back,x,y) 
Draws the background at position (x,y). (Without color blending and no alpha transparency.)

draw_background_stretched.description:
[Function]draw_background_stretched(back,x,y,w,h) 
Draws the background stretched to the indicated region.

draw_background_tiled.description:
[Function]draw_background_tiled(back,x,y) 
Draws the background tiled so that it fills the entire room.

draw_background_part.description:
[Function]draw_background_part(x,y,r,outline) 
Draws the indicated part of the background with the top-left corner of the part at position (x,y).

draw_sprite_ext.description:
[Function]draw_sprite_ext(sprite,subimg,x,y,xscale,yscale,rot,color,alpha) 
Draws the sprite scaled with factors xscale and yscale and rotated counterclockwise over rot degrees. color is the blending color (use c_white for no blending) and alpha indicates the transparency factor with which the images is merged with its background. A value of 0 makes the sprite completely transparent. A value of 1 makes it completely solid. This function can create great effect (for example partially transparent explosions).

draw_sprite_stretched_ext.description:
[Function]draw_sprite_stretched_ext(sprite,subimg,x,y,w,h,color,alpha) 
Draws the sprite stretched so that it fills the region with top-left corner (x,y) and width w and height h. color is the blending color and alpha indicates the transparency setting.

draw_sprite_tiled_ext.description:
[Function]draw_circle(sprite,subimg,x,y,xscale,yscale,color,alpha) 
Draws the sprite tiled so that it fills the entire room but now with scale factors and a color and transparency setting.

draw_sprite_part_ext.description:
[Function]draw_sprite_part_ext(sprite,subimg,left,top,width,height,x,y,xscale,yscale,color,alpha) 
Draws the indicated part of subimage subimg (-1 = current) of the sprite with the top-left corner of the part at position (x,y) but now with scale factors and a color and transparency setting.

draw_sprite_general.description:
[Function]draw_sprite_general(sprite,subimg,left,top,width,height,x,y,xscale,yscale,rot,c1,c2,c3,c4,alpha) 
The most general drawing function. It draws the indicated part of subimage subimg (-1 = current) of the sprite with the top-left corner of the part at position (x,y) but now with scale factors, a rotation angle, a color for each of the four vertices (top-left, top-right, bottom-right, and bottom-left), and an alpha transparency value. Note that rotation takes place around the top-left corner of the part.

draw_set_font.description:
[Function]draw_set_font(font) 
Sets the font that will be used when drawing text. Use -1 to set the default font (Arial 12).

draw_set_halign.description:
[Function]draw_set_halign(halign) 
Sets the horizontal alignment used when drawing text. Choose one of the following constants as values: 
fa_left 
fa_center 
fa_right

draw_set_valign.description:
[Function]draw_set_valign(valign) 
Sets the vertical alignment used when drawing text. Choose one of the following constants as values: 
fa_top 
fa_middle 
fa_bottom

draw_text_transformed.description:
[Function]draw_text_transformed(x,y,string,xscale,yscale,angle) 
Draws the string at position (x,y) in the same way as above, but scale it horizontally and vertically with the indicated factors and rotate it counter-clockwise over angle degrees.

draw_text_ext_transformed.description:
[Function]draw_text_ext_transformed(x,y,string,sep,w,xscale,yscale,angle) 
Combines the function draw_text_ext and draw_text_transformed. It makes it possible to draw a multi-line text rotated and scaled.

draw_text_color.description:
[Function]draw_text_color(x,y,string,c1,c2,c3,c4,alpha) 
Draws the string at position (x,y) like above. The four colors specify the colors of the top-left, top-right, bottom-right, and bottom-left corner of the text. alpha is the alpha transparency to be used (0-1).

draw_text_ext_color.description:
[Function]draw_text_ext_color(x,y,string,sep,w,c1,c2,c3,c4,alpha) 
Similar to draw_text_ext() but with colored vertices.

draw_text_transformed_color.description:
[Function]draw_text_transformed_color(x,y,string,xscale,yscale,angle,c1,c2,c3,c4,alpha) 
Similar to draw_text_transformed() but with colored vertices.

draw_text_ext_transformed_color.description:
[Function]draw_text_transformed_color(x,y,string,sep,w,xscale,yscale,angle,c1,c2,c3,c4,alpha) 
Similar to draw_text_ext_transformed() but with colored vertices.
